articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: British Airways: Flights cancelled amid IT crash
articles.description: All British Airways flights leaving Heathrow and Gatwick are cancelled until 18:00 BST.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: British Airways: Computer problems hit passengers
articles.description: The airline says it has no evidence at this stage to suggest a cyber attack.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Manchester attack: Terror threat reduced from critical to severe
articles.description: The national terrorism threat level comes down to severe, meaning an attack is likely, not imminent.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: IRA bombing campaign 'wrong' - Jeremy Corbyn
articles.description: Jeremy Corbyn seeks to distance himself from the IRA's actions in the Troubles, as the Tories step up criticism.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Chris Cornell: Friends and family at Soundgarden singer's funeral
articles.description: Friends and family attend the funeral of the Soundgarden singer at an LA cemetery.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Scottish Cup final: Celtic 1-1 Aberdeen - Armstrong levels after Hayes opener
articles.description: TV, radio and text coverage of the Scottish Cup final as Celtic aim for a treble and Aberdeen try to win the trophy for the first time in 27 years.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: G7 talks: Trump isolated over Paris climate change deal
articles.description: Germany called the climate change talks "very unsatisfactory", describing them as "six against one".

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Manchester attack: Editor defends publishing leaked photos
articles.description: The New York Times' decision to publish crime scene images was criticised by many in the UK.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Portland deaths: Two stabbed trying to stop anti-Muslim abuse
articles.description: Two men are stabbed to death on a train in Portland as they try to stop a man abusing two women.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: T in the Park death: Teenager's drink 'might have been spiked'
articles.description: Megan Bell died at T in the Park and had "extremely high levels of ecstasy" in her bloodstream.
